title.narrative: Sustainable Management of the Mbe River Forested

description.narrative: Sustainable Management of the Mbe River Forested Watershed through the Development of a Payments for Ecosystem Services (PES)
Gestion durable des éco-systèmes de la rivière Mbé pour le paiement des services environnementaux
capital of a political entity
independent political entity
Energy - policy, planning and administration

Design a sustainable financing mechanism for long-term protection of the MbÃ© River forested watershed, while strengthening the legal, policy and institutional framework necessary to ensure its adoption and successful implementation
A collaborative framework proposed and initiated

comment.narrative: Collaboration between key institutions involved in PES exists by EOP

A consultant was recruited for a study of the legal framewalk and policies. The study will make recommendations on ecosystem services in the various laws governing land use and propose legal obligations for water users to contribute to watershed management.
The study will ensure that payments and compensations are possible, and define who has the right to buy and sell ecosystem services.

description.narrative: Establish a baseline for populations of selected biodiversity indicators and conservation target species in the watershed and control areas

comment.narrative: Baseline exists for watershed and control site at end of project
3 local committees composed of around 150 people were created to participate in the project and will be the beneficiaries of the project

description.narrative: % of watershed with management plan taking into account watershed protection and biodiversity conservation
Revenue distribution (sharing) mechanism proposed with guidelines to orient funds to watershed protection

Legal, policy and institutional framework provide enabling support forâ€”and key institutions have improved capacity to design, manage, implement, monitor and learn lessons fromâ€”a PES scheme for the MBÃ‰ watershed
Inter-ministerial coordination in proposed collaborative framework, biannual meetings

comment.narrative: 2 inter-ministerial meetings per year beginning PY2

A consultant was recruited for a study of the legal framewalk and policies. The study will make recommendations on ecosystem services in the various laws governing land use and propose legal obligations for water users to contribute to watershed management.
The study will ensure that payments and compensations are possible, and define who has the right to buy and sell ecosystem services.

description.narrative: At the end of project (EOP), a national policy is drafted

comment.narrative: Proposal for harmonizing sectoral policies agreed by EOP

description.narrative: Central government training needs assessed and implemented

comment.narrative: Training needs assessment completed by end of PY1
5 people were trained in technics to evaluate service payments

description.narrative: Number of staff of key agencies trained in PES best practices

comment.narrative: 60-100% of relevant central government staff have received training necessary to design, manage and monitor and replicate PES scheme by EOP (short courses, study tours, fieldwork etc.)

description.narrative: Number of people who know about PES as a means of watershed protection for the Congo basin expanded

comment.narrative: At least 3 articles reporting on the design of the PES scheme

description.narrative: A pilot PES scheme that rewards the maintenance, improvement or adoption of conservation-friendly land uses, together with an associated monitoring plan, are designed
PES mechanisms designed and contract developed between buyers and sellers;

comment.narrative: Detailed proposal for PES scheme is drafted by EOP

A consultant was recruited for a study of the legal framewalk and policies. The study will make recommendations on ecosystem services in the various laws governing land use and propose legal obligations for water users to contribute to watershed management.
The study will ensure that payments and compensations are possible, and define who has the right to buy and sell ecosystem services.

description.narrative: Major beneficiaries engaged by the end of Year 2

comment.narrative: Contract for PES between SEEG and Government signed by EOP
The contract is drafted and will be signed after the study of PES

description.narrative: Management plans of land units include provisions for watershed protection and biodiversity conservation

comment.narrative: At the end of project, management plans exist for 100% of target area

description.narrative: Mechanisms for law enforcement in place

comment.narrative: Law enforcement operational in key hotspots

comment.narrative: At EOP hunting for bush meat has decreased by 30%
